node.title: Firefighters battle blaze at South African parliament building in Cape Town
node.alt: Smoke rises from buildings with Cape Town's Table Mountain in the distance on a sunny morning
node.description: After fighting the blaze for several hours, firefighters had partially contained the fire, local officials said, with its cause of the fire still unknown.
node.content:
["A fire has erupted at South Africa's\u00a0parliament in Cape Town, with flames bursting from the roof of a building, causing smoke that could be seen from kilometres away.", "After fighting the blaze for several hours on Sunday morning, firefighters had partially contained the fire, local officials said.", "But\u00a0smoke was still billowing from one of the several buildings that make up the parliament complex in the legislative capital of\u00a0Cape Town.", "\"The fire has been contained in the Old Wing. Firefighters are currently trying to control the fire in the New Wing, where the fire has affected the National Assembly Chamber,\" South African parliament said in a statement.", "Public Works and Infrastructure Minister Patricia De Lille said\u00a0there were no reports of any injuries.", "The cause of the fire\u00a0was not yet known.", "Jean-Pierre Smith, a Cape Town mayoral committee member responsible for safety and security, said\u00a0that firefighters had detected cracks on the wall and the roof in one area had collapsed.", "Some 60 firefighters and 12 fire-fighting vehicles and pieces of equipment, including a sky lift hydraulic platform, were on site trying to contain the fire, he said.", "", "
The fire at South Africa's Parliament ravaged both the old and new wings.(AP: Jerome Delay)
", "Thick smoke billowed from the roof of the National Assembly building and from the entrance as emergency services sprayed water inside.", "The fire started in an office complex and spread towards a gym just before 6:00am local time.", "It came a day after Cape Town hosted a state funeral for Archbishop Demond Tutu, who died last week at the age of 90.", "Reuters/ABC"]
